The Origins of Osiris, Munich, reviews the various suggestions made by scholars of earlier generations who sought to identify the Egyptian god Osiris with a Mesopotamian prototype. He quotes S. Mercer, The Religion of Ancient Egypt, who identified Osiris with Asar, a title of the Babylonian god Marduk, citing many correspondences between them. Despite the fact that the Egyptian name of Osiris is Asar, it is unlikely that such speculations would attract much support today, but Osiris’ origins remain obscure
